doc:
Edwin Carewe https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edwin_Carewe 0 Edwin Carewe (March 3, 1883 – January 22, 1940) was a Native American motion picture director, actor, producer, and screenwriter. His birth name was Jay John Fox; he was born in Gainesville, Texas. His father, Frank Fox, was white; his mother Sallie (Priddy) Fox was Chickasaw. Edwin and his two brothers, F. Finis and Wallace Carewe were enrolled members of the Chickasaw Nation. He was likely the most prolific of Native American directors of feature films in Hollywood history. Edwin_Carewe ( March_3_,_1883 – January_22_,_1940 ) was a_Native_American_motion_picture_director , actor , producer , and screenwriter . His_birth_name was Jay_John_Fox ; he was_born in Gainesville , Texas . His_father , Frank_Fox , was white ; his_mother_Sallie_(_Priddy_)_Fox was Chickasaw . Edwin and his_two_brothers , F._Finis and Wallace_Carewe were_enrolled members of the_Chickasaw_Nation . He was_likely the_most_prolific of Native_American_directors of feature_films in Hollywood_history .
